metadata.feature_description: Integrates Bootstrap responsive grid system for column layouts.

steps.action: Navigate to a page with Content Layout module and enable edit mode
steps.expected: Page loads with Content Layout columns visible
steps.actual: Page loaded successfully with Content Layout columns showing panes F30A_Pane1, F30A_Pane2, 9977_Pane1, 9977_Pane2, 9977_Pane3, 9977_Pane4

steps.action: Use JavaScript to verify Bootstrap CSS file is loaded in the page
steps.expected: Bootstrap CSS file should be loaded from ContentLayout module path

steps.action: Inspect DOM elements to verify Bootstrap column classes are applied to Content Layout panes
steps.expected: Column elements should have Bootstrap grid classes (col-lg-*, col-md-*, col-sm-*, col-xs-*)
steps.actual: Found 6 column elements with Bootstrap classes. Sample element: 'pane col-lg-6 col-md-6 col-sm-6 col-xs-12 dnnSortable dnnModuleManager ui-sortable ui-resizable'. Unique classes used: col-lg-6, col-md-6, col-sm-6, col-xs-12, col-lg-3, col-md-4

steps.action: Verify 2-column and 4-column layouts use correct Bootstrap classes
steps.expected: 2-column layout should use col-*-6, 4-column layout should use col-*-3
steps.actual: 2-column layout uses col-lg-6 col-md-6 col-sm-6 col-xs-12, 4-column layout uses col-lg-3 col-md-4 col-sm-6 col-xs-12. All layouts properly wrapped with dnn-cl class (3 wrapper elements found)

steps.expected: Columns should remain side-by-side at sm breakpoint due to col-sm-* classes
steps.actual: At 768px width, the 2-column layout with TELEVISIONS and WEARABLES remained side-by-side as expected (col-sm-6 classes active)

steps.expected: Columns should stack vertically on mobile due to col-xs-12 classes
steps.actual: At 480px width, columns stacked vertically with each column taking full width (col-xs-12 active). TELEVISIONS, TABLETS, and WEARABLES all displayed as full-width stacked blocks

steps.action: View Content Layout columns at mobile viewport width (480px)
steps.expected: All columns should stack vertically and display at full width
steps.actual: All columns displayed full-width and stacked vertically. Each pane with col-xs-12 class correctly rendered at 100% width

steps.expected: Columns should return to side-by-side layout
steps.actual: Desktop layout restored correctly with columns displaying side-by-side using col-lg-* classes

steps.action: Inspect page head section for respond.js conditional comment for IE8
steps.expected: Page should contain IE8 conditional comment with respond.js script reference
steps.actual: Found respond.js with IE8 conditional comment in page head: '<!--[if IE 8]><script src=".../ContentLayout/ClientScripts/respond.min.js"></script><![endif]-->'. The InjectRespondJsForIE8() method in View.ascx.cs correctly adds this script for IE8 compatibility

observations: Bootstrap v3.2.0 is used, customized with .dnn-cl wrapper class to scope styles and prevent conflicts with other Bootstrap instances on the page
The ColumnSizesHelper.cs provides predefined CSS class mappings for common column layouts (25/75, 50/50, 33/33/33, 25/25/25/25)
All Bootstrap column classes use col-xs-12 as fallback for mobile, ensuring columns always stack on small screens
The respond.js polyfill is conditionally loaded only for IE8 to enable media query support in that legacy browser
